sv:property.sv:value: Magnolia makes enterprise-strength web content management easy to use, easy to customize and easy to integrate into your environment.

This section demonstrates the use of content templates. Use content templates to create articles, news, events or similar type of pages. Content templates allow you to build your content from a variety of components. Content templates are also used by teaser components and aggregation templates as their target, and for that reason allow you to define additional information like a teaser image within their Page Info dialog. Aggregation or teaser components can then reuse the information found within a content page.

This section demonstrates the use of content templates. Use content templates to create articles, news, events or similar type of pages. Content templates allow you to build your content from a variety of components. Content templates are also used by teaser components and aggregation templates as their target, and for that reason allow you to define additional information like a teaser image within their Page Info dialog. Aggregation or teaser components can then reuse the information found within a content page.
A kicker is displayed above the Headline

The text & image component can be considered the staple of many typical websites. Use it to fill your articles with content consisting of text and images. It provides a heading for the text block and a rich text editor with options typical found in word-processing software.

The image tab allows you to select an image from any of the configured asset stores. By default, you can either upload an image which will be used locally on this page, or select one from the DMS (Magnolia's integrated Document Management System).

Magnolia's rich-text editor is highly customizable. By default it is configured to minimize the available options and provides features such as:

  • formatting
  • adding links
  • creating tables
  • pasting from Word or Rich text
  • undo and redo
The caption for a table
Image Store Availability
Local upload Default
Magnolia's Document Management System Default
Magnolia On Air - Digital Asset Management With Magnolia On Air Broadcasting & Publishing Solution
A quote component is a simple component that allows you to quote someone.
A "Link List" allows you to add as many links as you like.

This is the abstract for the "Glossary Term" page. A "Glossary Term" template is used to create entries for a glossary, which are automatically aggregated by the Glossary and "Glossary Letter" template. Otherwise, a Glossary Term page behaves pretty much like a standard article. "Glossary Term" pages are typically created below a "Glossary Letter" page to group the terms.
The abstract is a brief résumé on the content of this page. The abstract is typically displayed at the beginning of a page. The abstract is also used in teasers that reference this page and as the "description" meta-information if the Page Info's "description" field is empty. The description is often used by search engines to display information about the page.

The text & image component can be considered the staple of many typical websites. Use it to fill your articles with content consisting of text and images. It provides a heading for the text block and a rich text editor with options typical found in word-processing software.

This section demonstrates the use of "special" templates. These are templates that are either not available to "normal" editors (because they are used for pages that only exist once per site) or execute some functionality upon the creation of a page. For instance, if you create a Glossary page, it will automatically create subpages for each letter.

This section demonstrates the use of "special" templates. These are templates that are either not available to "normal" editors (because they are used for pages that only exist once per site) or execute some functionality upon the creation of a page. For instance, if you create a Glossary page, it will automatically create subpages for each letter.

The "Image Gallery" template is an example of a specific page template that shows an image gallery with minimal editor interaction – you create the page, select a folder containing the images and optionally restrict the number of images to be displayed.

A "Glossary" template is used to create a page that aggregates glossary terms. Once an editor opens a new "Glossary" page, it will automatically create sub-pages – one for each letter in the Alphabet. These "Glossary Letter" pages aggregate all Glossary Terms for the letter they represent.
The Glossary page contains a navigation menu for the letters and lists the first available terms for each letter.

Art is the process or product of deliberately arranging elements in a way that appeals to the sense or emotions. It encompasses a diverse range of human activities, creations, and modes of expression, including music and literature. The meaning of art is explored in a branch of philosophy known as Aesthetics.

The definition and evaluation of art has become especially problematic since the early 20th century. Richard Wollheim distinguishes three approaches: the Realist, whereby aesthetic quality is an absolute value independent of any human view; the Objectivist, whereby it is also an absolute value, but is dependent on general human experience; and the Relativist position, whereby it is not an absolute value, but depends on, and varies with, the human experience of different humans.[1] An object may be characterized by the intentions, or lack thereof, of its creator, regardless of its apparent purpose. A cup, which ostensibly can be used as a container, may be considered art if intended solely as an ornament, while a painting may be deemed craft if mass-produced.

Traditionally, the term art was used to refer to any skill or mastery. This conception changed during the Romantic period, when art came to be seen as "a special faculty of the human mind to be classified with religion and science".[2] Generally, art is made with the intention of stimulating thoughts and emotions.

The nature of art has been described by Richard Wollheim as "one of the most elusive of the traditional problems of human culture".[3]

It has been defined as a vehicle for the expression or communication of emotions and ideas, a means for exploring and appreciating formal elements for their own sake, and as

mimesis or representation. [4]

Leo Tolstoy identified art as a use of indirect means to communicate from one person to another.[4]

Benedetto Croce and R.G. Collingwood advanced the idealist view that art expresses emotions, and that the work of art therefore essentially exists in the mind of the creator. [5][6]

The "FAQ Template" allows you to create a typical Frequently Asked Questions (FAQ) section.
Questions can be preceded by an automatically created, customizable index.
Please follow the "Contact" link in the header section of this site, or simply click here to contact us.
Can I order Fazooom-2000 from the EU?
Yes of course. Simply call our friendly sales staff at 123-4567 and we'll be happy to help.

The "Site Map" template renders an automatically generated site map. You can configure if you wish to show only a part of the site, which is useful for micro-sites or to create section site-maps. Other options allow you to restrict the depth of the site-map and chose which information you wish to display within the site-map.

Dear ${email}:
Your message has been sent to someone@some-site.com.
Your message: ${message}
----- Thank you,
Someone

A "Contact Form" template allows you to easily create custom forms. Form elements can be grouped. Form data can be validated using configurable validators.
By default, form data can be sent via email or logged to the file system. A separate confirmation mail can be sent. Mails can be either HTML or plain text.
Form data is processed using plug-able form data processors, which allows you to customize form data processing without changing the Magnolia core system.
A description to explain more about this field.

The "News Overview" template displays the latest news. It aggregates all content pages that have been created with the "News" template. You can configure to page the results and restrict the aggregation to a specific site-tree in order to have section-specific news.
The "News Overview" template will only display news that have a publishing date of the current date or earlier.
This is second of four steps you need to complete in this "Call for Paper" multi-step form example.
Please select the appropriate track for your presentation
If you need anything special, please indicate so
We are delighted to have received your proposal. We will get back to you within the next 4 weeks to notify you if your proposal has been accepted.
This multi-step form provides you with an example how a conference's Call for Paper could collect submissions through a multi-step form.
Multi-Step Form: Call for Paper Example
Please use your main email address to ensure we can reach you

This is the abstract of an event-page. It is a brief résumé on the content of this page. The abstract on the beginning of a page is also used in teasers and openers that reference this page. Li Europan lingues es membres del sam familie. Lor separat existentie es un myth.
Li Europan lingues es membres del sam familie. Lor separat existentie es un myth.

Li Europan lingues es membres del sam familie. Lor separat existentie es un myth. Por scientie, musica, sport etc, litot Europa usa li sam vocabular. Li lingues differe solmen in li grammatica, li pronunciation e li plu commun vocabules. Omnicos directe al desirabilite de un nov lingua franca: On refusa continuar payar custosi traductores. At solmen va esser necessi far uniform grammatica, pronunciation e plu sommun paroles. Ma quande lingues coalesce, li grammatica del resultant lingue es plu simplic e regulari quam ti del coalescent lingues. Li nov lingua franca va esser plu simplic e regulari quam li existent Europan lingues.

The RSS Aggregator aggregates external or internal RSS/Atom feeds and can produce website content out of those feeds.
The RSS Aggregator aggregates external or internal RSS/Atom feeds and can produce website content out of those feeds.

This is the "Section Header". It is often simply inherited by all pages within a section to provide context regarding the current section.
This is the "Section Header". It is often simply inherited by all pages within a section to provide context regarding the current section.
The "Main Area" is used to display the main body of content for a page. On a section page, the Main Area will contain teasers to subsections, articles, news, events or any other content.
The "Main Area" is used to display the main body of content for a page. On a section page, the Main Area will contain teasers to subsections, articles, news, events or any other content.
The "Extras Area" is displayed to the right of the "Main Area" and is often used to display extra information, for instance a calendar or contact information.
The "Extras Area" is displayed to the right of the "Main Area" and is often used to display extra information, for instance a calendar or contact information.
The components displayed in the Extras Area are inherited from the parent page.
The components displayed in the Extras Area are inherited from the parent page.
This is the "Extras Area". The "Extras Area" is displayed to the right of the "Main Area" and is often used to display extra information, for instance a calendar or contact information.

The "Promos Area" can be used to promote special events or deals. It typically is configured to float, i.e. it will display to the right of the Main and Extra's content if the window is wide enough; otherwise it will be shown below the Main (and for really small width, below the Extra's) area.

The "Promos Area" can be used to promote special events or deals. It typically is configured to float, i.e. it will display to the right of the Main and Extra's content if the window is wide enough; otherwise it will be shown below the Main (and for really small width, below the Extra's) area.
You can provide your promotional text right here or take it from the page you tease.
The components displayed in the Promos Area are inherited from the parent page.
The components displayed in the Promos Area are inherited from the parent page.

The "Base Area" is located below the main content / above the footer and spreads across the complete page. It is typically used to display a teaser carrousel or a large tag cloud. Unlike the footer, its content is specific to the current page.

Each STK template has a number of configuration options. This section demonstrates some variations of section pages which can be achieved simply through configuration.
Each STK template has a number of configuration options. This section demonstrates some variations of section pages which can be achieved simply through configuration.
This section page demonstrates floating with two columns. Resize (and possibly reload) the page to see the effect. Note that the Extras-area and the Opener have been disabled.
This section page demonstrates an opener that starts the main area. Floating is turned off, the Extras-area is displayed.
A section page that does not start with an opener.
This section page shows a variation with no section header but an intro.
Section Page with Intro & No Header
This section page variation demonstrates a section page with a section header and without an intro.
On this section page no extras area is available/shown. The teasers in the main area spread to the promos area.
On this section page no extras area is available/shown. The Promos area is also disabled. The teasers in the main area spread to the (disabled) promos area.

Welcome. This is the sample page to show the Public User Registration features in Standard templating kit with using of Form module.

Welcome to the demo-features site. This site demonstrates various Magnolia features in a structured manner. Unlike the demo-project site, which shows you a selection of features in the context of complete pages, the demo-features site aims to focus on a single feature per page.
